execution_summary: Built a Python 3.10 environment with pandas, numpy, scikit-learn, linearmodels, statsmodels, and scipy. Created a Python translation of the Stata do-file (KMYR__py.py), which: loaded finaldata_noNA.csv; constructed NAff = gdp/pop; IMS = totalimport/(gdp*10000); EXS = totalexport/(gdp*10000); removed outliers using MinCovDet (as an approximation to Hadi), flagging 118 and retaining 666 rows; created five-year period dummies; computed within-country lags for IMS, EXS, and unemployment; and estimated a country fixed-effects PanelOLS with period dummies. Two-way and country-only clustering were incompatible with the model data, so the model used robust SEs. Execution completed successfully, producing a regression summary and estimates. The focal coefficient on lagged IMS was negative and not statistically significant, diverging from the original positive significant result. The dataset covers 1965–2018, which differs from the original 1970–2003 window.

code_executed.logs: Loaded shape: (784, 8). Flagged outliers: 118. Final regression sample: 636 observations; entities: 30; years: 53. Two-way clustering failed; one-way clustering failed; used robust SEs. Saved outputs to /app/data/original/10/python.
code_executed.environment: Python 3.10-slim with pandas>=2.0, numpy>=1.24, scikit-learn>=1.2, linearmodels>=5.4, statsmodels>=0.14, scipy>=1.10

results.hypothesis_tested: Imports from the South will be positively associated with national affluence.

findings_summary.outcome_name: Coefficient on L_IMS (lagged Imports from the South)
Coefficient on L_EXS (lagged Exports to the South)

tables.table_id: Replication model (corresponds to focal specification with country FE and period dummies)
tables.table_description: PanelOLS summary for NAff on lagged IMS, lagged EXS, lagged unemployment, five-year period dummies, and country fixed effects with robust SEs.
Machine-readable estimates including coefficient, SE, p-value, CI, and sample sizes for the focal predictor L_IMS.
